meanings.definition: Decorative cutting with a zigzag edge.
meanings.sent1: She used pinking scissors to create a fancy edge on the fabric.
meanings.sent2: The pinking on the dress hem added a unique touch to the design.
meanings.sent3: The pinking on the gift wrap made it look like a festive banner.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity soared as she incorporated pinking into her craft projects.
meanings.sent5: The pinking on the invitation gave it an elegant and stylish look.

meanings.definition: To make a series of small holes in something.
meanings.sent1: He was pinking the leather to prepare it for stitching.
meanings.sent2: She carefully pinking the paper to create a decorative border.
meanings.sent3: The tailor accidentally pinking the fabric too close to the edge.
meanings.sent4: The rain pinking the soil made it easier for the seeds to germinate.
meanings.sent5: The artist pinking the canvas to add a unique texture to the painting.

meanings.sent1: The sunset painted the sky in a beautiful pinking hue.
meanings.sent2: Her cheeks turned a lovely pinking shade when she blushed.
meanings.sent3: The soft pinking of the flower petals reminded her of a delicate blush.
meanings.sent4: The morning sky was a canvas of pinking and golden hues.
meanings.sent5: The pinking of the rose petals gave them a romantic and gentle appearance.
